    8397             :     an escape character (backslash) and another character and other control
    8398             :     characters by a sequence of "\u" followed by a four-digit hex
    8399             :     representation.
    8400             : 
    8401             :     @param[in] s  the string to escape
    8402             :     @return  the escaped string
    8403             : 
    8404             :     @complexity Linear in the length of string @a s.
    8405             :     */
    8406           0 :     static string_t escape_string(const string_t& s)
    8407             :     {
    8408           0 :         const auto space = extra_space(s);
    8409           0 :         if (space == 0)
    8410             :         {
    8411           0 :             return s;
    8412             :         }
    8413             : 
    8414             :         // create a result string of necessary size
    8415           0 :         string_t result(s.size() + space, '\\');
    8416           0 :         std::size_t pos = 0;
    8417             : 
    8418           0 :         for (const auto& c : s)
    8419             :         {
    8420           0 :             switch (c)
    8421             :             {
    8422             :             // quotation mark (0x22)
    8423             :             case '"':
    8424             :             {
    8425           0 :                 result[pos + 1] = '"';
    8426           0 :                 pos += 2;
    8427           0 :                 break;
    8428             :             }
    8429             : 
    8430             :             // reverse solidus (0x5c)
    8431             :             case '\\':
    8432             :             {
    8433             :                 // nothing to change
    8434           0 :                 pos += 2;
    8435           0 :                 break;
    8436             :             }
    8437             : 
    8438             :             // backspace (0x08)
    8439             :             case '\b':
    8440             :             {
    8441           0 :                 result[pos + 1] = 'b';
    8442           0 :                 pos += 2;
    8443           0 :                 break;
    8444             :             }
    8445             : 
    8446             :             // formfeed (0x0c)
    8447             :             case '\f':
    8448             :             {
    8449           0 :                 result[pos + 1] = 'f';
    8450           0 :                 pos += 2;
    8451           0 :                 break;
    8452             :             }
    8453             : 
    8454             :             // newline (0x0a)
    8455             :             case '\n':
    8456             :             {
    8457           0 :                 result[pos + 1] = 'n';
    8458           0 :                 pos += 2;
    8459           0 :                 break;
    8460             :             }
    8461             : 
    8462             :             // carriage return (0x0d)
    8463             :             case '\r':
    8464             :             {
    8465           0 :                 result[pos + 1] = 'r';
    8466           0 :                 pos += 2;
    8467           0 :                 break;
    8468             :             }
    8469             : 
    8470             :             // horizontal tab (0x09)
    8471             :             case '\t':
    8472             :             {
    8473           0 :                 result[pos + 1] = 't';
    8474           0 :                 pos += 2;
    8475           0 :                 break;
    8476             :             }
    8477             : 
    8478             :             default:
    8479             :             {
    8480           0 :                 if (c >= 0x00 and c <= 0x1f)
    8481             :                 {
    8482             :                     // convert a number 0..15 to its hex representation
    8483             :                     // (0..f)
    8484             :                     static const char hexify[16] = {'0', '1', '2', '3',
    8485             :                                                     '4', '5', '6', '7',
    8486             :                                                     '8', '9', 'a', 'b',
    8487             :                                                     'c', 'd', 'e', 'f'};
    8488             : 
    8489             :                     // print character c as \uxxxx
    8490           0 :                     for (const char m :
    8491           0 :                          {'u', '0', '0', hexify[c >> 4], hexify[c & 0x0f]})
    8492             :                     {
    8493           0 :                         result[++pos] = m;
    8494             :                     }
    8495             : 
    8496           0 :                     ++pos;
    8497             :                 }
    8498             :                 else
    8499             :                 {
    8500             :                     // all other characters are added as-is
    8501           0 :                     result[pos++] = c;
    8502             :                 }
    8503           0 :                 break;
    8504             :             }
    8505             :             }
    8506             :         }
    8507             : 
    8508           0 :         return result;
    8509             :     }
    8510             : 
    8511             :     /*!
    8512             :     @brief locale-independent serialization for built-in arithmetic types
    8513             :     */
    8514             :     struct numtostr
    8515             :     {
    8516             :     public:
    8517             :         template <typename NumberType>
    8518           0 :         numtostr(NumberType value)
    8519           0 :         {
    8520           0 :             x_write(value, std::is_integral<NumberType>());
    8521           0 :         }
    8522             : 
    8523           0 :         const char* c_str() const { return m_buf.data(); }
    8524             :     private:
    8525             :         /// a (hopefully) large enough character buffer
    8526             :         std::array<char, 64> m_buf{{}};
    8527             : 
    8528             :         template <typename NumberType>
    8529           0 :         void x_write(NumberType x, /*is_integral=*/std::true_type)
    8530             :         {
    8531             :             // special case for "0"
    8532           0 :             if (x == 0)
    8533             :             {
    8534           0 :                 m_buf[0] = '0';
    8535           0 :                 return;
    8536             :             }
    8537             : 
    8538           0 :             const bool is_negative = x < 0;
    8539           0 :             size_t i = 0;
    8540             : 
    8541             :             // spare 1 byte for '\0'
    8542           0 :             while (x != 0 and i < m_buf.size() - 1)
    8543             :             {
    8544           0 :                 const auto digit = std::labs(static_cast<long>(x % 10));
    8545           0 :                 m_buf[i++] = static_cast<char>('0' + digit);
    8546           0 :                 x /= 10;
    8547             :             }
    8548             : 
    8549             :             // make sure the number has been processed completely
    8550           0 :             assert(x == 0);
    8551             : 
    8552           0 :             if (is_negative)
    8553             :             {
    8554             :                 // make sure there is capacity for the '-'
    8555           0 :                 assert(i < m_buf.size() - 2);
    8556           0 :                 m_buf[i++] = '-';
    8557             :             }
    8558             : 
    8559           0 :             std::reverse(m_buf.begin(), m_buf.begin() + i);
    8560             :         }
    8561             : 
    8562             :         template <typename NumberType>
    8563           0 :         void x_write(NumberType x, /*is_integral=*/std::false_type)
    8564             :         {
    8565             :             // special case for 0.0 and -0.0
    8566           0 :             if (x == 0)
    8567             :             {
    8568           0 :                 size_t i = 0;
    8569           0 :                 if (std::signbit(x))
    8570             :                 {
    8571           0 :                     m_buf[i++] = '-';
    8572             :                 }
    8573           0 :                 m_buf[i++] = '0';
    8574           0 :                 m_buf[i++] = '.';
    8575           0 :                 m_buf[i] = '0';
    8576           0 :                 return;
    8577             :             }
    8578             : 
    8579             :             // get number of digits for a text -> float -> text round-trip
    8580             :             static constexpr auto d = std::numeric_limits<NumberType>::digits10;
    8581             : 
    8582             :             // the actual conversion
    8583             :             const auto written_bytes =
    8584           0 :                 snprintf(m_buf.data(), m_buf.size(), "%.*g", d, x);
    8585             : 
    8586             :             // negative value indicates an error
    8587           0 :             assert(written_bytes > 0);
    8588             :             // check if buffer was large enough
    8589           0 :             assert(static_cast<size_t>(written_bytes) < m_buf.size());
    8590             : 
    8591             :             // read information from locale
    8592           0 :             const auto loc = localeconv();
    8593           0 :             assert(loc != nullptr);
    8594             :             const char thousands_sep =
    8595           0 :                 !loc->thousands_sep ? '\0' : loc->thousands_sep[0];
    8596             : 
    8597             :             const char decimal_point =
    8598           0 :                 !loc->decimal_point ? '\0' : loc->decimal_point[0];
    8599             : 
    8600             :             // erase thousands separator
    8601           0 :             if (thousands_sep != '\0')
    8602             :             {
    8603             :                 const auto end =
    8604           0 :                     std::remove(m_buf.begin(), m_buf.begin() + written_bytes,
    8605           0 :                                 thousands_sep);
    8606           0 :                 std::fill(end, m_buf.end(), '\0');
    8607             :             }
    8608             : 
    8609             :             // convert decimal point to '.'
    8610           0 :             if (decimal_point != '\0' and decimal_point != '.')
    8611             :             {
    8612           0 :                 for (auto& c : m_buf)
    8613             :                 {
    8614           0 :                     if (c == decimal_point)
    8615             :                     {
    8616           0 :                         c = '.';
    8617           0 :                         break;
    8618             :                     }
    8619             :                 }
    8620             :             }
    8621             : 
    8622             :             // determine if need to append ".0"
    8623           0 :             size_t i = 0;
    8624           0 :             bool value_is_int_like = true;
    8625           0 :             for (i = 0; i < m_buf.size(); ++i)
    8626             :             {
    8627             :                 // break when end of number is reached
    8628           0 :                 if (m_buf[i] == '\0')
    8629             :                 {
    8630           0 :                     break;
    8631             :                 }
    8632             : 
    8633             :                 // check if we find non-int character
    8634           0 :                 value_is_int_like = value_is_int_like and m_buf[i] != '.' and
    8635           0 :                                     m_buf[i] != 'e' and m_buf[i] != 'E';
    8636             :             }
    8637             : 
    8638           0 :             if (value_is_int_like)
    8639             :             {
    8640             :                 // there must be 2 bytes left for ".0"
    8641           0 :                 assert((i + 2) < m_buf.size());
    8642             :                 // we write to the end of the number
    8643           0 :                 assert(m_buf[i] == '\0');
    8644           0 :                 assert(m_buf[i - 1] != '\0');
    8645             : 
    8646             :                 // add ".0"
    8647           0 :                 m_buf[i] = '.';
    8648           0 :                 m_buf[i + 1] = '0';
    8649             : 
    8650             :                 // the resulting string is properly terminated
    8651           0 :                 assert(m_buf[i + 2] == '\0');
    8652             :             }
    8653             :         }
    8654             :     };
    8655             : 
    8656             :     /*!
    8657             :     @brief internal implementation of the serialization function
    8658             : 
    8659             :     This function is called by the public member function dump and organizes
    8660             :     the serialization internally. The indentation level is propagated as
    8661             :     additional parameter. In case of arrays and objects, the function is
    8662             :     called recursively. Note that
    8663             : 
    8664             :     - strings and object keys are escaped using `escape_string()`
    8665             :     - integer numbers are converted implicitly via `operator<<`
    8666             :     - floating-point numbers are converted to a string using `"%g"` format
    8667             : 
    8668             :     @param[out] o              stream to write to
    8669             :     @param[in] pretty_print    whether the output shall be pretty-printed
    8670             :     @param[in] indent_step     the indent level
    8671             :     @param[in] current_indent  the current indent level (only used internally)
    8672             :     */
    8673           0 :     void dump(std::ostream& o, const bool pretty_print,
    8674             :               const unsigned int indent_step,
    8675             :               const unsigned int current_indent = 0) const
    8676             :     {
    8677             :         // variable to hold indentation for recursive calls
    8678           0 :         unsigned int new_indent = current_indent;
    8679             : 
    8680           0 :         switch (m_type)
    8681             :         {
    8682             :         case value_t::object:
    8683             :         {
    8684           0 :             if (m_value.object->empty())
    8685             :             {
    8686           0 :                 o << "{}";
    8687           0 :                 return;
    8688             :             }
    8689             : 
    8690           0 :             o << "{";
    8691             : 
    8692             :             // increase indentation
    8693           0 :             if (pretty_print)
    8694             :             {
    8695           0 :                 new_indent += indent_step;
    8696           0 :                 o << "\n";
    8697             :             }
    8698             : 
    8699           0 :             for (auto i = m_value.object->cbegin(); i != m_value.object->cend();
    8700             :                  ++i)
    8701             :             {
    8702           0 :                 if (i != m_value.object->cbegin())
    8703             :                 {
    8704           0 :                     o << (pretty_print ? ",\n" : ",");
    8705             :                 }
    8706           0 :                 o << string_t(new_indent, ' ') << "\""
    8707           0 :                   << escape_string(i->first)
    8708           0 :                   << "\":" << (pretty_print ? " " : "");
    8709           0 :                 i->second.dump(o, pretty_print, indent_step, new_indent);
    8710             :             }
    8711             : 
    8712             :             // decrease indentation
    8713           0 :             if (pretty_print)
    8714             :             {
    8715           0 :                 new_indent -= indent_step;
    8716           0 :                 o << "\n";
    8717             :             }
    8718             : 
    8719           0 :             o << string_t(new_indent, ' ') + "}";
    8720           0 :             return;
    8721             :         }
    8722             : 
    8723             :         case value_t::array:
    8724             :         {
    8725           0 :             if (m_value.array->empty())
    8726             :             {
    8727           0 :                 o << "[]";
    8728           0 :                 return;
    8729             :             }
    8730             : 
    8731           0 :             o << "[";
    8732             : 
    8733             :             // increase indentation
    8734           0 :             if (pretty_print)
    8735             :             {
    8736           0 :                 new_indent += indent_step;
    8737           0 :                 o << "\n";
    8738             :             }
    8739             : 
    8740           0 :             for (auto i = m_value.array->cbegin(); i != m_value.array->cend();
    8741             :                  ++i)
    8742             :             {
    8743           0 :                 if (i != m_value.array->cbegin())
    8744             :                 {
    8745           0 :                     o << (pretty_print ? ",\n" : ",");
    8746             :                 }
    8747           0 :                 o << string_t(new_indent, ' ');
    8748           0 :                 i->dump(o, pretty_print, indent_step, new_indent);
    8749             :             }
    8750             : 
    8751             :             // decrease indentation
    8752           0 :             if (pretty_print)
    8753             :             {
    8754           0 :                 new_indent -= indent_step;
    8755           0 :                 o << "\n";
    8756             :             }
    8757             : 
    8758           0 :             o << string_t(new_indent, ' ') << "]";
    8759           0 :             return;
    8760             :         }
    8761             : 
    8762             :         case value_t::string:
    8763             :         {
    8764           0 :             o << string_t("\"") << escape_string(*m_value.string) << "\"";
    8765           0 :             return;
    8766             :         }
    8767             : 
    8768             :         case value_t::boolean:
    8769             :         {
    8770           0 :             o << (m_value.boolean ? "true" : "false");
    8771           0 :             return;
    8772             :         }
    8773             : 
    8774             :         case value_t::number_integer:
    8775             :         {
    8776           0 :             o << numtostr(m_value.number_integer).c_str();
    8777           0 :             return;
    8778             :         }
    8779             : 
    8780             :         case value_t::number_unsigned:
    8781             :         {
    8782           0 :             o << numtostr(m_value.number_unsigned).c_str();
    8783           0 :             return;
    8784             :         }
    8785             : 
    8786             :         case value_t::number_float:
    8787             :         {
    8788           0 :             o << numtostr(m_value.number_float).c_str();
    8789           0 :             return;
    8790             :         }
    8791             : 
    8792             :         case value_t::discarded:
    8793             :         {
    8794           0 :             o << "<discarded>";
    8795           0 :             return;
    8796             :         }
    8797             : 
    8798             :         case value_t::null:
    8799             :         {
    8800           0 :             o << "null";
    8801           0 :             return;
    8802             :         }
    8803             :         }
    8804             :     }
    8805             : 
    8806             : private:
    8807             :     //////////////////////
    8808             :     // member variables //
    8809             :     //////////////////////
    8810             : 
    8811             :     /// the type of the current element
    8812             :     value_t m_type = value_t::null;
    8813             : 
    8814             :     /// the value of the current element
    8815             :     json_value m_value = {};
    8816             : 
    8817             : private:
    8818             :     ///////////////
    8819             :     // iterators //
    8820             :     ///////////////
    8821             : 
    8822             :     /*!
    8823             :     @brief an iterator for primitive JSON types
    8824             : 
    8825             :     This class models an iterator for primitive JSON types (boolean, number,
    8826             :     string). It's only purpose is to allow the iterator/const_iterator classes
    8827             :     to "iterate" over primitive values. Internally, the iterator is modeled by
    8828             :     a `difference_type` variable. Value begin_value (`0`) models the begin,
    8829             :     end_value (`1`) models past the end.
    8830             :     */
    8831             :     class primitive_iterator_t
    8832             :     {
    8833             :     public:
    8834             :         difference_type get_value() const noexcept { return m_it; }
    8835             :         /// set iterator to a defined beginning
    8836             :         void set_begin() noexcept { m_it = begin_value; }
    8837             :         /// set iterator to a defined past the end
    8838             :         void set_end() noexcept { m_it = end_value; }
    8839             :         /// return whether the iterator can be dereferenced
    8840             :         constexpr bool is_begin() const noexcept
    8841             :         {
    8842             :             return (m_it == begin_value);
    8843             :         }
    8844             : 
    8845             :         /// return whether the iterator is at end
    8846             :         constexpr bool is_end() const noexcept { return (m_it == end_value); }
    8847             :         friend constexpr bool operator==(primitive_iterator_t lhs,
    8848             :                                          primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
    8849             :         {
    8850             :             return lhs.m_it == rhs.m_it;
    8851             :         }
    8852             : 
    8853             :         friend constexpr bool operator!=(primitive_iterator_t lhs,
    8854             :                                          primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
    8855             :         {
    8856             :             return !(lhs == rhs);
    8857             :         }
    8858             : 
    8859             :         friend constexpr bool operator<(primitive_iterator_t lhs,
    8860             :                                         primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
    8861             :         {
    8862             :             return lhs.m_it < rhs.m_it;
    8863             :         }
    8864             : 
    8865             :         friend constexpr bool operator<=(primitive_iterator_t lhs,
    8866             :                                          primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
    8867             :         {
    8868             :             return lhs.m_it <= rhs.m_it;
    8869             :         }
    8870             : 
    8871             :         friend constexpr bool operator>(primitive_iterator_t lhs,
    8872             :                                         primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
    8873             :         {
    8874             :             return lhs.m_it > rhs.m_it;
    8875             :         }
    8876             : 
    8877             :         friend constexpr bool operator>=(primitive_iterator_t lhs,
    8878             :                                          primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
    8879             :         {
    8880             :             return lhs.m_it >= rhs.m_it;
    8881             :         }
    8882             : 
    8883             :         primitive_iterator_t operator+(difference_type i)
    8884             :         {
    8885             :             auto result = *this;
    8886             :             result += i;
    8887             :             return result;
    8888             :         }
    8889             : 
    8890             :         friend constexpr difference_type operator-(
    8891             :             primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
    8892             :         {
    8893             :             return lhs.m_it - rhs.m_it;
    8894             :         }
    8895             : 
    8896             :         friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os,
    8897             :                                         primitive_iterator_t it)
    8898             :         {
    8899             :             return os << it.m_it;
    8900             :         }
    8901             : 
    8902             :         primitive_iterator_t& operator++()
    8903             :         {
    8904             :             ++m_it;
    8905             :             return *this;
    8906             :         }
    8907             : 
    8908             :         primitive_iterator_t operator++(int)
    8909             :         {
    8910             :             auto result = *this;
    8911             :             m_it++;
    8912             :             return result;
    8913             :         }
    8914             : 
    8915             :         primitive_iterator_t& operator--()
    8916             :         {
    8917             :             --m_it;
    8918             :             return *this;
    8919             :         }
    8920             : 
    8921             :         primitive_iterator_t operator--(int)
    8922             :         {
    8923             :             auto result = *this;
    8924             :             m_it--;
    8925             :             return result;
    8926             :         }
    8927             : 
    8928             :         primitive_iterator_t& operator+=(difference_type n)
    8929             :         {
    8930             :             m_it += n;
    8931             :             return *this;
    8932             :         }
    8933             : 
    8934             :         primitive_iterator_t& operator-=(difference_type n)
    8935             :         {
    8936             :             m_it -= n;
    8937             :             return *this;
    8938             :         }
    8939             : 
    8940             :     private:
    8941             :         static constexpr difference_type begin_value = 0;
    8942             :         static constexpr difference_type end_value = begin_value + 1;
    8943             : 
    8944             :         /// iterator as signed integer type
    8945             :         difference_type m_it =
    8946             :             std::numeric_limits<std::ptrdiff_t>::denorm_min();
    8947             :     };
    8948             : 
    8949             :     /*!
    8950             :     @brief an iterator value
    8951             : 
    8952             :     @note This structure could easily be a union, but MSVC currently does not
    8953             :     allow unions members with complex constructors, see
    8954             :     https://github.com/nlohmann/json/pull/105.
    8955             :     */
    8956             :     struct internal_iterator
    8957             :     {
    8958             :         /// iterator for JSON objects
    8959             :         typename object_t::iterator object_iterator;
    8960             :         /// iterator for JSON arrays
    8961             :         typename array_t::iterator array_iterator;
    8962             :         /// generic iterator for all other types
    8963             :         primitive_iterator_t primitive_iterator;
    8964             : 
    8965             :         /// create an uninitialized internal_iterator
    8966             :         internal_iterator() noexcept : object_iterator(),
    8967             :                                        array_iterator(),
    8968             :                                        primitive_iterator()
    8969             :         {
    8970             :         }
    8971             :     };
    8972             : 
    8973             :     /// proxy class for the iterator_wrapper functions
    8974             :     template <typename IteratorType>
    8975             :     class iteration_proxy
    8976             :     {
    8977             :     private:
    8978             :         /// helper class for iteration
    8979             :         class iteration_proxy_internal
    8980             :         {
    8981             :         private:
    8982             :             /// the iterator
    8983             :             IteratorType anchor;
    8984             :             /// an index for arrays (used to create key names)
    8985             :             size_t array_index = 0;
    8986             : 
    8987             :         public:
    8988             :             explicit iteration_proxy_internal(IteratorType it) noexcept
    8989             :                 : anchor(it)
    8990             :             {
    8991             :             }
    8992             : 
    8993             :             /// dereference operator (needed for range-based for)
    8994             :             iteration_proxy_internal& operator*() { return *this; }
    8995             :             /// increment operator (needed for range-based for)
    8996             :             iteration_proxy_internal& operator++()
    8997             :             {
    8998             :                 ++anchor;
    8999             :                 ++array_index;
    9000             : 
    9001             :                 return *this;
    9002             :             }
    9003             : 
    9004             :             /// inequality operator (needed for range-based for)
    9005             :             bool operator!=(const iteration_proxy_internal& o) const
    9006             :             {
    9007             :                 return anchor != o.anchor;
    9008             :             }
    9009             : 
    9010             :             /// return key of the iterator
    9011             :             typename basic_json::string_t key() const
    9012             :             {
    9013             :                 assert(anchor.m_object != nullptr);
    9014             : 
    9015             :                 switch (anchor.m_object->type())
    9016             :                 {
    9017             :                 // use integer array index as key
    9018             :                 case value_t::array:
    9019             :                 {
    9020             :                     return std::to_string(array_index);
    9021             :                 }
    9022             : 
    9023             :                 // use key from the object
    9024             :                 case value_t::object:
    9025             :                 {
    9026             :                     return anchor.key();
    9027             :                 }
    9028             : 
    9029             :                 // use an empty key for all primitive types
    9030             :                 default:
    9031             :                 {
    9032             :                     return "";
    9033             :                 }
    9034             :                 }
    9035             :             }
    9036             : 
    9037             :             /// return value of the iterator
    9038             :             typename IteratorType::reference value() const
    9039             :             {
    9040             :                 return anchor.value();
    9041             :             }
    9042             :         };
    9043             : 
    9044             :         /// the container to iterate
    9045             :         typename IteratorType::reference container;
    9046             : 
    9047             :     public:
    9048             :         /// construct iteration proxy from a container
    9049             :         explicit iteration_proxy(typename IteratorType::reference cont)
    9050             :             : container(cont)
    9051             :         {
    9052             :         }
    9053             : 
    9054             :         /// return iterator begin (needed for range-based for)
    9055             :         iteration_proxy_internal begin() noexcept
    9056             :         {
    9057             :             return iteration_proxy_internal(container.begin());
    9058             :         }
    9059             : 
    9060             :         /// return iterator end (needed for range-based for)
    9061             :         iteration_proxy_internal end() noexcept
    9062             :         {
    9063             :             return iteration_proxy_internal(container.end());
    9064             :         }
    9065             :     };
    9066             : 
    9067             : public:
    9068             :     /*!
    9069             :     @brief a template for a random access iterator for the @ref basic_json class
    9070             : 
    9071             :     This class implements a both iterators (iterator and const_iterator) for the
    9072             :     @ref basic_json class.
    9073             : 
    9074             :     @note An iterator is called *initialized* when a pointer to a JSON value
    9075             :           has been set (e.g., by a constructor or a copy assignment). If the
    9076             :           iterator is default-constructed, it is *uninitialized* and most
    9077             :           methods are undefined. **The library uses assertions to detect calls
    9078             :           on uninitialized iterators.**
    9079             : 
    9080             :     @requirement The class satisfies the following concept requirements:
    9081             :     -
    9082             :     [RandomAccessIterator](http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/concept/RandomAccessIterator):
    9083             :       The iterator that can be moved to point (forward and backward) to any
    9084             :       element in constant time.
    9085             : 
    9086             :     @since version 1.0.0, simplified in version 2.0.9
    9087             :     */
    9088             :     template <typename U>
    9089             :     class iter_impl : public std::iterator<std::random_access_iterator_tag, U>
    9090             :     {
    9091             :         /// allow basic_json to access private members
    9092             :         friend class basic_json;
    9093             : 
    9094             :         // make sure U is basic_json or const basic_json
    9095             :         static_assert(std::is_same<U, basic_json>::value or
    9096             :                           std::is_same<U, const basic_json>::value,
    9097             :                       "iter_impl only accepts (const) basic_json");
    9098             : 
    9099             :     public:
    9100             :         /// the type of the values when the iterator is dereferenced
    9101             :         using value_type = typename basic_json::value_type;
    9102             :         /// a type to represent differences between iterators
    9103             :         using difference_type = typename basic_json::difference_type;
    9104             :         /// defines a pointer to the type iterated over (value_type)
    9105             :         using pointer =
    9106             :             typename std::conditional<std::is_const<U>::value,
    9107             :                                       typename basic_json::const_pointer,
    9108             :                                       typename basic_json::pointer>::type;
    9109             :         /// defines a reference to the type iterated over (value_type)
    9110             :         using reference =
    9111             :             typename std::conditional<std::is_const<U>::value,
    9112             :                                       typename basic_json::const_reference,
    9113             :                                       typename basic_json::reference>::type;
    9114             :         /// the category of the iterator
    9115             :         using iterator_category = std::bidirectional_iterator_tag;
    9116             : 
    9117             :         /// default constructor
    9118             :         iter_impl() = default;
    9119             : 
    9120             :         /*!
    9121             :         @brief constructor for a given JSON instance
    9122             :         @param[in] object  pointer to a JSON object for this iterator
    9123             :         @pre object != nullptr
    9124             :         @post The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
    9125             :         */
    9126             :         explicit iter_impl(pointer object) noexcept : m_object(object)
    9127             :         {
    9128             :             assert(m_object != nullptr);
    9129             : 
    9130             :             switch (m_object->m_type)
    9131             :             {
    9132             :             case basic_json::value_t::object:
    9133             :             {
    9134             :                 m_it.object_iterator = typename object_t::iterator();
    9135             :                 break;
    9136             :             }
    9137             : 
    9138             :             case basic_json::value_t::array:
    9139             :             {
    9140             :                 m_it.array_iterator = typename array_t::iterator();
    9141             :                 break;
    9142             :             }
    9143             : 
    9144             :             default:
    9145             :             {
    9146             :                 m_it.primitive_iterator = primitive_iterator_t();
    9147             :                 break;
    9148             :             }
    9149             :             }
    9150             :         }
    9151             : 
    9152             :         /*
    9153             :         Use operator `const_iterator` instead of `const_iterator(const iterator&
    9154             :         other) noexcept` to avoid two class definitions for @ref iterator and
    9155             :         @ref const_iterator.
    9156             : 
    9157             :         This function is only called if this class is an @ref iterator. If this
    9158             :         class is a @ref const_iterator this function is not called.
    9159             :         */
    9160             :         operator const_iterator() const
    9161             :         {
    9162             :             const_iterator ret;
    9163             : 
    9164             :             if (m_object)
    9165             :             {
    9166             :                 ret.m_object = m_object;
    9167             :                 ret.m_it = m_it;
    9168             :             }
    9169             : 
    9170             :             return ret;
    9171             :         }
    9172             : 
    9173             :         /*!
    9174             :         @brief copy constructor
    9175             :         @param[in] other  iterator to copy from
    9176             :         @note It is not checked whether @a other is initialized.
    9177             :         */
    9178             :         iter_impl(const iter_impl& other) noexcept : m_object(other.m_object),
    9179             :                                                      m_it(other.m_it)
    9180             :         {
    9181             :         }
    9182             : 
    9183             :         /*!
    9184             :         @brief copy assignment
    9185             :         @param[in,out] other  iterator to copy from
    9186             :         @note It is not checked whether @a other is initialized.
    9187             :         */
    9188             :         iter_impl& operator=(iter_impl other) noexcept(
    9189             :             std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<pointer>::value and
    9190             :                 std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<pointer>::value and std::
    9191             :                     is_nothrow_move_constructible<internal_iterator>::value and
    9192             :                         std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<
    9193             :                             internal_iterator>::value)
    9194             :         {
    9195             :             std::swap(m_object, other.m_object);
    9196             :             std::swap(m_it, other.m_it);
    9197             :             return *this;
    9198             :         }
    9199             : 
    9200             :     private:
    9201             :         /*!
    9202             :         @brief set the iterator to the first value
    9203             :         @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
    9204             :         */
    9205             :         void set_begin() noexcept
    9206             :         {
    9207             :             assert(m_object != nullptr);
    9208             : 
    9209             :             switch (m_object->m_type)
    9210             :             {
    9211             :             case basic_json::value_t::object:
    9212             :             {
    9213             :                 m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_value.object->begin();
    9214             :                 break;
    9215             :             }
    9216             : 
    9217             :             case basic_json::value_t::array:
    9218             :             {
    9219             :                 m_it.array_iterator = m_object->m_value.array->begin();
    9220             :                 break;
    9221             :             }
    9222             : 
    9223             :             case basic_json::value_t::null:
    9224             :             {
    9225             :                 // set to end so begin()==end() is true: null is empty
    9226             :                 m_it.primitive_iterator.set_end();
    9227             :                 break;
    9228             :             }
    9229             : 
    9230             :             default:
    9231             :             {
    9232             :                 m_it.primitive_iterator.set_begin();
    9233             :                 break;
    9234             :             }
    9235             :             }
    9236             :         }
    9237             : 
    9238             :         /*!
    9239             :         @brief set the iterator past the last value
    9240             :         @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
    9241             :         */

    9243             :         {
    9244             :             assert(m_object != nullptr);
    9245             : 
    9246             :             switch (m_object->m_type)
    9247             :             {
    9248             :             case basic_json::value_t::object:
    9249             :             {
    9250             :                 m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_value.object->end();
    9251             :                 break;
    9252             :             }

    9263             :                 break;
    9264             :             }
    9265             :             }
    9266             :         }
    9267             : 
    9268             :     public:
    9269             :         /*!
    9270             :         @brief return a reference to the value pointed to by the iterator
    9271             :         @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
    9272             :         */
    9273             :         reference operator*() const
    9274             :         {
    9275             :             assert(m_object != nullptr);
    9276             : 
    9277             :             switch (m_object->m_type)
    9278             :             {
    9279             :             case basic_json::value_t::object:
    9280             :             {
    9281             :                 assert(m_it.object_iterator != m_object->m_value.object->end());
    9282             :                 return m_it.object_iterator->second;
    9283             :             }
    9284             : 
    9285             :             case basic_json::value_t::array:
    9286             :             {
    9287             :                 assert(m_it.array_iterator != m_object->m_value.array->end());
    9288             :                 return *m_it.array_iterator;
    9289             :             }
    9290             : 
    9291             :             case basic_json::value_t::null:
    9292             :             {
    9293             :                 JSON_THROW(std::out_of_range("cannot get value"));
    9294             :             }
    9295             : 
    9296             :             default:
    9297             :             {
    9298             :                 if (m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin())
    9299             :                 {
    9300             :                     return *m_object;
    9301             :                 }
    9302             : 
    9303             :                 JSON_THROW(std::out_of_range("cannot get value"));
    9304             :             }
    9305             :             }
    9306             :         }
    9307             : 
    9308             :         /*!
    9309             :         @brief dereference the iterator
    9310             :         @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
    9311             :         */
    9312             :         pointer operator->() const
    9313             :         {
    9314             :             assert(m_object != nullptr);
    9315             : 
    9316             :             switch (m_object->m_type)
    9317             :             {
    9318             :             case basic_json::value_t::object:
    9319             :             {
    9320             :                 assert(m_it.object_iterator != m_object->m_value.object->end());
    9321             :                 return &(m_it.object_iterator->second);
    9322             :             }
    9323             : 
    9324             :             case basic_json::value_t::array:
    9325             :             {
    9326             :                 assert(m_it.array_iterator != m_object->m_value.array->end());

    9328             :             }
    9329             : 
    9330             :             default:
    9331             :             {
    9332             :                 if (m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin())
    9333             :                 {
    9334             :                     return m_object;
    9335             :                 }
    9336             : 
    9337             :                 JSON_THROW(std::out_of_range("cannot get value"));
    9338             :             }
    9339             :             }
    9340             :         }
    9341             : 
    9342             :         /*!
    9343             :         @brief post-increment (it++)
    9344             :         @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.

    9347             :         {
    9348             :             auto result = *this;
    9349             :             ++(*this);
    9350             :             return result;
    9351             :         }

    9359             :             assert(m_object != nullptr);

    9390             :         {
    9391             :             auto result = *this;
    9392             :             --(*this);
    9393             :             return result;

    9415             :                 break;

    9421             :                 break;
    9422             :             }

    9429             :         @brief  comparison: equal
    9430             :         @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
    9431             :         */

    9433             :         {
    9434             :             // if objects are not the same, the comparison is undefined
    9435             :             if (m_object != other.m_object)
    9436             :             {
    9437             :                 JSON_THROW(std::domain_error(
    9438             :                     "cannot compare iterators of different containers"));
    9439             :             }
    9440             :

    9446             :             {

    9448             :             }
    9449             : 
    9450             :             case basic_json::value_t::array:
    9451             :             {
    9452             :                 return (m_it.array_iterator == other.m_it.array_iterator);
    9453             :             }
    9454             : 
    9455             :             default:
    9456             :             {
    9457             :                 return (m_it.primitive_iterator ==
    9458             :                         other.m_it.primitive_iterator);
    9459             :             }
    9460             :             }
    9461             :         }
    9462             : 
    9463             :         /*!
    9464             :         @brief  comparison: not equal
    9465             :         @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
    9466             :         */
    9467             :         bool operator!=(const iter_impl& other) const
    9468             :         {
    9469             :             return not operator==(other);
    9470             :         }
    9471             : 
    9472             :         /*!
    9473             :         @brief  comparison: smaller
    9474             :         @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.

    9477             :         {
    9478             :             // if objects are not the same, the comparison is undefined
    9479             :             if (m_object != other.m_object)
    9480             :             {

    9482             :                     "cannot compare iterators of different containers"));

    9508             :         /*!
    9509             :         @brief  comparison: less than or equal
    9510             :         @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
    9511             :         */
    9512             :         bool operator<=(const iter_impl& other) const
    9513             :         {
    9514             :             return not other.operator<(*this);
    9515             :         }
    9516             :

    9522             :         {
    9523             :             return not operator<=(other);
    9524             :         }
    9525             : 
    9526             :         /*!
    9527             :         @brief  comparison: greater than or equal
    9528             :         @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
    9529             :         */
    9530             :         bool operator>=(const iter_impl& other) const
    9531             :         {
    9532             :             return not operator<(other);
    9533             :         }
    9534             : 
    9535             :         /*!
    9536             :         @brief  add to iterator
    9537             :         @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
    9538             :         */
    9539             :         iter_impl& operator+=(difference_type i)
    9540             :         {
    9541             :             assert(m_object != nullptr);
    9542             :

    9562             :             }

    9565             :         }
