   11697           0 :             return result.is_discarded() ? basic_json() : std::move(result);
   11698             :         }
   11699             : 
   11700             :     private:
   11701             :         /// the actual parser
   11702           0 :         basic_json parse_internal(bool keep)
   11703             :         {
   11704           0 :             auto result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
   11705             : 
   11706           0 :             switch (last_token)
   11707             :             {
   11708             :             case lexer::token_type::begin_object:
   11709             :             {
   11710           0 :                 if (keep and
   11711           0 :                     (not callback or
   11712           0 :                      ((keep = callback(depth++, parse_event_t::object_start,
   11713           0 :                                        result)) != 0)))
   11714             :                 {
   11715             :                     // explicitly set result to object to cope with {}
   11716           0 :                     result.m_type = value_t::object;
   11717           0 :                     result.m_value = value_t::object;
   11718             :                 }
   11719             : 
   11720             :                 // read next token
   11721           0 :                 get_token();
   11722             : 
   11723             :                 // closing } -> we are done
   11724           0 :                 if (last_token == lexer::token_type::end_object)
   11725             :                 {
   11726           0 :                     get_token();
   11727           0 :                     if (keep and callback and
   11728           0 :                         not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::object_end,
   11729             :                                      result))
   11730             :                     {
   11731           0 :                         result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
   11732             :                     }
   11733           0 :                     return result;
   11734             :                 }
   11735             : 
   11736             :                 // no comma is expected here
   11737           0 :                 unexpect(lexer::token_type::value_separator);
   11738             : 
   11739             :                 // otherwise: parse key-value pairs
   11740           0 :                 do
   11741             :                 {
   11742             :                     // ugly, but could be fixed with loop reorganization
   11743           0 :                     if (last_token == lexer::token_type::value_separator)
   11744             :                     {
   11745           0 :                         get_token();
   11746             :                     }
   11747             : 
   11748             :                     // store key
   11749           0 :                     expect(lexer::token_type::value_string);
   11750           0 :                     const auto key = m_lexer.get_string();
   11751             : 
   11752           0 :                     bool keep_tag = false;
   11753           0 :                     if (keep)
   11754             :                     {
   11755           0 :                         if (callback)
   11756             :                         {
   11757           0 :                             basic_json k(key);
   11758           0 :                             keep_tag = callback(depth, parse_event_t::key, k);
   11759             :                         }
   11760             :                         else
   11761             :                         {
   11762           0 :                             keep_tag = true;
   11763             :                         }
   11764             :                     }
   11765             : 
   11766             :                     // parse separator (:)
   11767           0 :                     get_token();
   11768           0 :                     expect(lexer::token_type::name_separator);
   11769             : 
   11770             :                     // parse and add value
   11771           0 :                     get_token();
   11772           0 :                     auto value = parse_internal(keep);
   11773           0 :                     if (keep and keep_tag and not value.is_discarded())
   11774             :                     {
   11775           0 :                         result[key] = std::move(value);
   11776             :                     }
   11777           0 :                 } while (last_token == lexer::token_type::value_separator);
   11778             : 
   11779             :                 // closing }
   11780           0 :                 expect(lexer::token_type::end_object);
   11781           0 :                 get_token();
   11782           0 :                 if (keep and callback and
   11783           0 :                     not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::object_end, result))
   11784             :                 {
   11785           0 :                     result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
   11786             :                 }
   11787             : 
   11788           0 :                 return result;
   11789             :             }
   11790             : 
   11791             :             case lexer::token_type::begin_array:
   11792             :             {
   11793           0 :                 if (keep and
   11794           0 :                     (not callback or
   11795           0 :                      ((keep = callback(depth++, parse_event_t::array_start,
   11796           0 :                                        result)) != 0)))
   11797             :                 {
   11798             :                     // explicitly set result to object to cope with []
   11799           0 :                     result.m_type = value_t::array;
   11800           0 :                     result.m_value = value_t::array;
   11801             :                 }
   11802             : 
   11803             :                 // read next token
   11804           0 :                 get_token();
   11805             : 
   11806             :                 // closing ] -> we are done
   11807           0 :                 if (last_token == lexer::token_type::end_array)
   11808             :                 {
   11809           0 :                     get_token();
   11810           0 :                     if (callback and
   11811           0 :                         not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::array_end, result))
   11812             :                     {
   11813           0 :                         result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
   11814             :                     }
   11815           0 :                     return result;
   11816             :                 }
   11817             : 
   11818             :                 // no comma is expected here
   11819           0 :                 unexpect(lexer::token_type::value_separator);
   11820             : 
   11821             :                 // otherwise: parse values
   11822           0 :                 do
   11823             :                 {
   11824             :                     // ugly, but could be fixed with loop reorganization
   11825           0 :                     if (last_token == lexer::token_type::value_separator)
   11826             :                     {
   11827           0 :                         get_token();
   11828             :                     }
   11829             : 
   11830             :                     // parse value
   11831           0 :                     auto value = parse_internal(keep);
   11832           0 :                     if (keep and not value.is_discarded())
   11833             :                     {
   11834           0 :                         result.push_back(std::move(value));
   11835             :                     }
   11836           0 :                 } while (last_token == lexer::token_type::value_separator);
   11837             : 
   11838             :                 // closing ]
   11839           0 :                 expect(lexer::token_type::end_array);
   11840           0 :                 get_token();
   11841           0 :                 if (keep and callback and
   11842           0 :                     not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::array_end, result))
   11843             :                 {
   11844           0 :                     result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
   11845             :                 }
   11846             : 
   11847           0 :                 return result;
   11848             :             }
   11849             : 
   11850             :             case lexer::token_type::literal_null:
   11851             :             {
   11852           0 :                 get_token();
   11853           0 :                 result.m_type = value_t::null;
   11854           0 :                 break;
   11855             :             }
   11856             : 
   11857             :             case lexer::token_type::value_string:
   11858             :             {
   11859           0 :                 const auto s = m_lexer.get_string();
   11860           0 :                 get_token();
   11861           0 :                 result = basic_json(s);
   11862           0 :                 break;
   11863             :             }
   11864             : 
   11865             :             case lexer::token_type::literal_true:
   11866             :             {
   11867           0 :                 get_token();
   11868           0 :                 result.m_type = value_t::boolean;
   11869           0 :                 result.m_value = true;
   11870           0 :                 break;
   11871             :             }
   11872             : 
   11873             :             case lexer::token_type::literal_false:
   11874             :             {
   11875           0 :                 get_token();
   11876           0 :                 result.m_type = value_t::boolean;
   11877           0 :                 result.m_value = false;
   11878           0 :                 break;
   11879             :             }
   11880             : 
   11881             :             case lexer::token_type::value_unsigned:
   11882             :             case lexer::token_type::value_integer:
   11883             :             case lexer::token_type::value_float:
   11884             :             {
   11885           0 :                 m_lexer.get_number(result, last_token);
   11886           0 :                 get_token();
   11887           0 :                 break;
   11888             :             }
   11889             : 
   11890             :             default:
   11891             :             {
   11892             :                 // the last token was unexpected
   11893           0 :                 unexpect(last_token);
   11894             :             }
   11895             :             }
   11896             : 
   11897           0 :             if (keep and callback and
   11898           0 :                 not callback(depth, parse_event_t::value, result))
   11899             :             {
   11900           0 :                 result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
   11901             :             }
   11902           0 :             return result;
   11903             :         }
   11904             : 
   11905             :         /// get next token from lexer
   11906           0 :         typename lexer::token_type get_token()
   11907             :         {
   11908           0 :             last_token = m_lexer.scan();
   11909           0 :             return last_token;
   11910             :         }
   11911             : 
   11912           0 :         void expect(typename lexer::token_type t) const
   11913             :         {
   11914           0 :             if (t != last_token)
   11915             :             {
   11916           0 :                 std::string error_msg = "parse error - unexpected ";
   11917           0 :                 error_msg += (last_token == lexer::token_type::parse_error
   11918           0 :                                   ? ("'" + m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'")
   11919           0 :                                   : lexer::token_type_name(last_token));
   11920           0 :                 error_msg += "; expected " + lexer::token_type_name(t);
   11921           0 :                 JSON_THROW(std::invalid_argument(error_msg));
   11922             :             }
   11923           0 :         }
   11924             : 
   11925           0 :         void unexpect(typename lexer::token_type t) const
   11926             :         {
   11927           0 :             if (t == last_token)
   11928             :             {
   11929           0 :                 std::string error_msg = "parse error - unexpected ";
   11930           0 :                 error_msg += (last_token == lexer::token_type::parse_error
   11931           0 :                                   ? ("'" + m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'")
   11932           0 :                                   : lexer::token_type_name(last_token));
   11933           0 :                 JSON_THROW(std::invalid_argument(error_msg));
   11934             :             }
   11935           0 :         }
   11936             : 
   11937             :     private:
   11938             :         /// current level of recursion
   11939             :         int depth = 0;
   11940             :         /// callback function
   11941             :         const parser_callback_t callback = nullptr;
   11942             :         /// the type of the last read token
   11943             :         typename lexer::token_type last_token =
   11944             :             lexer::token_type::uninitialized;
   11945             :         /// the lexer
   11946             :         lexer m_lexer;
   11947             :     };
   11948             : 
   11949             : public:
   11950             :     /*!
   11951             :     @brief JSON Pointer
   11952             : 
   11953             :     A JSON pointer defines a string syntax for identifying a specific value
   11954             :     within a JSON document. It can be used with functions `at` and
   11955             :     `operator[]`. Furthermore, JSON pointers are the base for JSON patches.
   11956             : 
   11957             :     @sa [RFC 6901](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901)
   11958             : 
   11959             :     @since version 2.0.0
   11960             :     */
   11961             :     class json_pointer
   11962             :     {
   11963             :         /// allow basic_json to access private members
   11964             :         friend class basic_json;
   11965             : 
   11966             :     public:
   11967             :         /*!
   11968             :         @brief create JSON pointer
   11969             : 
   11970             :         Create a JSON pointer according to the syntax described in
   11971             :         [Section 3 of RFC6901](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901#section-3).
   11972             : 
   11973             :         @param[in] s  string representing the JSON pointer; if omitted, the
   11974             :                       empty string is assumed which references the whole JSON
   11975             :                       value
   11976             : 
   11977             :         @throw std::domain_error if reference token is nonempty and does not
   11978             :         begin with a slash (`/`); example: `"JSON pointer must be empty or
   11979             :         begin with /"`
   11980             :         @throw std::domain_error if a tilde (`~`) is not followed by `0`
   11981             :         (representing `~`) or `1` (representing `/`); example: `"escape error:
   11982             :         ~ must be followed with 0 or 1"`
   11983             : 
   11984             :         @liveexample{The example shows the construction several valid JSON
   11985             :         pointers as well as the exceptional behavior.,json_pointer}
   11986             : 
   11987             :         @since version 2.0.0
   11988             :         */
   11989             :         explicit json_pointer(const std::string& s = "")
   11990             :             : reference_tokens(split(s))
   11991             :         {
   11992             :         }
   11993             : 
   11994             :         /*!
   11995             :         @brief return a string representation of the JSON pointer
   11996             : 
   11997             :         @invariant For each JSON pointer `ptr`, it holds:
   11998             :         @code {.cpp}
   11999             :         ptr == json_pointer(ptr.to_string());
   12000             :         @endcode
   12001             : 
   12002             :         @return a string representation of the JSON pointer
   12003             : 
   12004             :         @liveexample{The example shows the result of `to_string`.,
   12005             :         json_pointer__to_string}
   12006             : 
   12007             :         @since version 2.0.0
   12008             :         */
   12009             :         std::string to_string() const noexcept
   12010             :         {
   12011             :             return std::accumulate(reference_tokens.begin(),
   12012             :                                    reference_tokens.end(), std::string{},
   12013             :                                    [](const std::string& a,
   12014             :                                       const std::string& b) {
   12015             :                                        return a + "/" + escape(b);
   12016             :                                    });
   12017             :         }
   12018             : 
   12019             :         /// @copydoc to_string()
   12020             :         operator std::string() const { return to_string(); }
   12021             :     private:
   12022             :         /// remove and return last reference pointer
   12023             :         std::string pop_back()
   12024             :         {
   12025             :             if (is_root())
   12026             :             {
   12027             :                 JSON_THROW(std::domain_error("JSON pointer has no parent"));
   12028             :             }
   12029             : 
   12030             :             auto last = reference_tokens.back();
   12031             :             reference_tokens.pop_back();
   12032             :             return last;
   12033             :         }
   12034             : 
   12035             :         /// return whether pointer points to the root document
   12036             :         bool is_root() const { return reference_tokens.empty(); }
   12037             :         json_pointer top() const
   12038             :         {
   12039             :             if (is_root())
   12040             :             {
   12041             :                 JSON_THROW(std::domain_error("JSON pointer has no parent"));
   12042             :             }
   12043             : 
   12044             :             json_pointer result = *this;
   12045             :             result.reference_tokens = {reference_tokens[0]};
   12046             :             return result;
   12047             :         }
   12048             : 
   12049             :         /*!
   12050             :         @brief create and return a reference to the pointed to value
   12051             : 
   12052             :         @complexity Linear in the number of reference tokens.
   12053             :         */
   12054             :         reference get_and_create(reference j) const
   12055             :         {
   12056             :             pointer result = &j;
   12057             : 
   12058             :             // in case no reference tokens exist, return a reference to the
   12059             :             // JSON value j which will be overwritten by a primitive value
   12060             :             for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
   12061             :             {
   12062             :                 switch (result->m_type)
   12063             :                 {
   12064             :                 case value_t::null:
   12065             :                 {
   12066             :                     if (reference_token == "0")
   12067             :                     {
   12068             :                         // start a new array if reference token is 0
   12069             :                         result = &result->operator[](0);
   12070             :                     }
   12071             :                     else
   12072             :                     {
   12073             :                         // start a new object otherwise
   12074             :                         result = &result->operator[](reference_token);
   12075             :                     }
   12076             :                     break;
   12077             :                 }
   12078             : 
   12079             :                 case value_t::object:
   12080             :                 {
   12081             :                     // create an entry in the object
   12082             :                     result = &result->operator[](reference_token);
   12083             :                     break;
   12084             :                 }
   12085             : 
   12086             :                 case value_t::array:
   12087             :                 {
   12088             :                     // create an entry in the array
   12089             :                     result = &result->operator[](
   12090             :                         static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
   12091             :                     break;
   12092             :                 }
   12093             : 
   12094             :                 /*
   12095             :                 The following code is only reached if there exists a
   12096             :                 reference token _and_ the current value is primitive. In
   12097             :                 this case, we have an error situation, because primitive
   12098             :                 values may only occur as single value; that is, with an
   12099             :                 empty list of reference tokens.
   12100             :                 */
   12101             :                 default:
   12102             :                 {
   12103             :                     JSON_THROW(std::domain_error("invalid value to unflatten"));
   12104             :                 }
   12105             :                 }
   12106             :             }
   12107             : 
   12108             :             return *result;
   12109             :         }
   12110             : 
   12111             :         /*!
   12112             :         @brief return a reference to the pointed to value
   12113             : 
   12114             :         @note This version does not throw if a value is not present, but tries
   12115             :         to create nested values instead. For instance, calling this function
   12116             :         with pointer `"/this/that"` on a null value is equivalent to calling
   12117             :         `operator[]("this").operator[]("that")` on that value, effectively
   12118             :         changing the null value to an object.
   12119             : 
   12120             :         @param[in] ptr  a JSON value
   12121             : 
   12122             :         @return reference to the JSON value pointed to by the JSON pointer
   12123             : 
   12124             :         @complexity Linear in the length of the JSON pointer.
   12125             : 
   12126             :         @throw std::out_of_range      if the JSON pointer can not be resolved
   12127             :         @throw std::domain_error      if an array index begins with '0'
   12128             :         @throw std::invalid_argument  if an array index was not a number
   12129             :         */
   12130             :         reference get_unchecked(pointer ptr) const
   12131             :         {
   12132             :             for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
   12133             :             {
   12134             :                 // convert null values to arrays or objects before continuing
   12135             :                 if (ptr->m_type == value_t::null)
   12136             :                 {
   12137             :                     // check if reference token is a number
   12138             :                     const bool nums =
   12139             :                         std::all_of(reference_token.begin(),
   12140             :                                     reference_token.end(), [](const char x) {
   12141             :                                         return std::isdigit(x);
   12142             :                                     });
   12143             : 
   12144             :                     // change value to array for numbers or "-" or to object
   12145             :                     // otherwise
   12146             :                     if (nums or reference_token == "-")
   12147             :                     {
   12148             :                         *ptr = value_t::array;
   12149             :                     }
   12150             :                     else
   12151             :                     {
   12152             :                         *ptr = value_t::object;
   12153             :                     }
   12154             :                 }
   12155             : 
   12156             :                 switch (ptr->m_type)
   12157             :                 {
   12158             :                 case value_t::object:
   12159             :                 {
   12160             :                     // use unchecked object access
   12161             :                     ptr = &ptr->operator[](reference_token);
   12162             :                     break;
   12163             :                 }
   12164             : 
   12165             :                 case value_t::array:
   12166             :                 {
   12167             :                     // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
   12168             :                     if (reference_token.size() > 1 and
   12169             :                         reference_token[0] == '0')
   12170             :                     {
   12171             :                         JSON_THROW(std::domain_error(
   12172             :                             "array index must not begin with '0'"));
   12173             :                     }
   12174             : 
   12175             :                     if (reference_token == "-")
   12176             :                     {
   12177             :                         // explicitly treat "-" as index beyond the end
   12178             :                         ptr = &ptr->operator[](ptr->m_value.array->size());
   12179             :                     }
   12180             :                     else
   12181             :                     {
   12182             :                         // convert array index to number; unchecked access
   12183             :                         ptr = &ptr->operator[](
   12184             :                             static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
   12185             :                     }
   12186             :                     break;
   12187             :                 }
   12188             : 
   12189             :                 default:
   12190             :                 {
   12191             :                     JSON_THROW(
   12192             :                         std::out_of_range("unresolved reference token '" +
   12193             :                                           reference_token + "'"));
   12194             :                 }
   12195             :                 }
   12196             :             }
   12197             : 
   12198             :             return *ptr;
   12199             :         }
   12200             : 
   12201             :         reference get_checked(pointer ptr) const
   12202             :         {
   12203             :             for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
   12204             :             {
   12205             :                 switch (ptr->m_type)
   12206             :                 {
   12207             :                 case value_t::object:
   12208             :                 {
   12209             :                     // note: at performs range check
   12210             :                     ptr = &ptr->at(reference_token);
   12211             :                     break;
   12212             :                 }
   12213             : 
   12214             :                 case value_t::array:
   12215             :                 {
   12216             :                     if (reference_token == "-")
   12217             :                     {
   12218             :                         // "-" always fails the range check
   12219             :                         JSON_THROW(std::out_of_range(
   12220             :                             "array index '-' (" +
   12221             :                             std::to_string(ptr->m_value.array->size()) +
   12222             :                             ") is out of range"));
   12223             :                     }
   12224             : 
   12225             :                     // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
   12226             :                     if (reference_token.size() > 1 and
   12227             :                         reference_token[0] == '0')
   12228             :                     {
   12229             :                         JSON_THROW(std::domain_error(
   12230             :                             "array index must not begin with '0'"));
   12231             :                     }
   12232             : 
   12233             :                     // note: at performs range check
   12234             :                     ptr = &ptr->at(
   12235             :                         static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
   12236             :                     break;
   12237             :                 }
   12238             : 
   12239             :                 default:
   12240             :                 {
   12241             :                     JSON_THROW(
   12242             :                         std::out_of_range("unresolved reference token '" +
   12243             :                                           reference_token + "'"));
   12244             :                 }
   12245             :                 }
   12246             :             }
   12247             : 
   12248             :             return *ptr;
   12249             :         }
   12250             : 
   12251             :         /*!
   12252             :         @brief return a const reference to the pointed to value
   12253             : 
   12254             :         @param[in] ptr  a JSON value
   12255             : 
   12256             :         @return const reference to the JSON value pointed to by the JSON
   12257             :                 pointer
   12258             :         */
   12259             :         const_reference get_unchecked(const_pointer ptr) const
   12260             :         {
   12261             :             for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
   12262             :             {
   12263             :                 switch (ptr->m_type)
   12264             :                 {
   12265             :                 case value_t::object:
   12266             :                 {
   12267             :                     // use unchecked object access
   12268             :                     ptr = &ptr->operator[](reference_token);
   12269             :                     break;
   12270             :                 }
   12271             : 
   12272             :                 case value_t::array:
   12273             :                 {
   12274             :                     if (reference_token == "-")
   12275             :                     {
   12276             :                         // "-" cannot be used for const access
   12277             :                         JSON_THROW(std::out_of_range(
   12278             :                             "array index '-' (" +
   12279             :                             std::to_string(ptr->m_value.array->size()) +
   12280             :                             ") is out of range"));
   12281             :                     }
   12282             : 
   12283             :                     // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
   12284             :                     if (reference_token.size() > 1 and
   12285             :                         reference_token[0] == '0')
   12286             :                     {
   12287             :                         JSON_THROW(std::domain_error(
   12288             :                             "array index must not begin with '0'"));
   12289             :                     }
   12290             : 
   12291             :                     // use unchecked array access
   12292             :                     ptr = &ptr->operator[](
   12293             :                         static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
   12294             :                     break;
   12295             :                 }
   12296             : 
   12297             :                 default:
   12298             :                 {
   12299             :                     JSON_THROW(
   12300             :                         std::out_of_range("unresolved reference token '" +
   12301             :                                           reference_token + "'"));
   12302             :                 }
   12303             :                 }
   12304             :             }
   12305             : 
   12306             :             return *ptr;
   12307             :         }
   12308             : 
   12309             :         const_reference get_checked(const_pointer ptr) const
   12310             :         {
   12311             :             for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
   12312             :             {
   12313             :                 switch (ptr->m_type)
   12314             :                 {
   12315             :                 case value_t::object:
   12316             :                 {
   12317             :                     // note: at performs range check
   12318             :                     ptr = &ptr->at(reference_token);
   12319             :                     break;
   12320             :                 }
   12321             : 
   12322             :                 case value_t::array:
   12323             :                 {
   12324             :                     if (reference_token == "-")
   12325             :                     {
   12326             :                         // "-" always fails the range check
   12327             :                         JSON_THROW(std::out_of_range(
   12328             :                             "array index '-' (" +
   12329             :                             std::to_string(ptr->m_value.array->size()) +
   12330             :                             ") is out of range"));
   12331             :                     }
   12332             : 
   12333             :                     // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
   12334             :                     if (reference_token.size() > 1 and
   12335             :                         reference_token[0] == '0')
   12336             :                     {
   12337             :                         JSON_THROW(std::domain_error(
   12338             :                             "array index must not begin with '0'"));
   12339             :                     }
   12340             : 
   12341             :                     // note: at performs range check
   12342             :                     ptr = &ptr->at(
   12343             :                         static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
   12344             :                     break;
   12345             :                 }
   12346             : 
   12347             :                 default:
   12348             :                 {
   12349             :                     JSON_THROW(
   12350             :                         std::out_of_range("unresolved reference token '" +
   12351             :                                           reference_token + "'"));
   12352             :                 }
   12353             :                 }
   12354             :             }
   12355             : 
   12356             :             return *ptr;
   12357             :         }
   12358             : 
   12359             :         /// split the string input to reference tokens
   12360             :         static std::vector<std::string> split(
   12361             :             const std::string& reference_string)
   12362             :         {
   12363             :             std::vector<std::string> result;
   12364             : 
   12365             :             // special case: empty reference string -> no reference tokens
   12366             :             if (reference_string.empty())
   12367             :             {
   12368             :                 return result;
   12369             :             }
   12370             : 
   12371             :             // check if nonempty reference string begins with slash
   12372             :             if (reference_string[0] != '/')
   12373             :             {
   12374             :                 JSON_THROW(std::domain_error(
   12375             :                     "JSON pointer must be empty or begin with '/'"));
   12376             :             }
   12377             : 
   12378             :             // extract the reference tokens:
   12379             :             // - slash: position of the last read slash (or end of string)
   12380             :             // - start: position after the previous slash
   12381             :             for (
   12382             :                 // search for the first slash after the first character
   12383             :                 size_t slash = reference_string.find_first_of('/', 1),
   12384             :                        // set the beginning of the first reference token
   12385             :                 start = 1;
   12386             :                 // we can stop if start == string::npos+1 = 0
   12387             :                 start != 0;
   12388             :                 // set the beginning of the next reference token
   12389             :                 // (will eventually be 0 if slash == std::string::npos)
   12390             :                 start = slash + 1,
   12391             :                        // find next slash
   12392             :                 slash = reference_string.find_first_of('/', start))
   12393             :             {
   12394             :                 // use the text between the beginning of the reference token
   12395             :                 // (start) and the last slash (slash).
   12396             :                 auto reference_token =
   12397             :                     reference_string.substr(start, slash - start);
   12398             : 
   12399             :                 // check reference tokens are properly escaped
   12400             :                 for (size_t pos = reference_token.find_first_of('~');
   12401             :                      pos != std::string::npos;
   12402             :                      pos = reference_token.find_first_of('~', pos + 1))
   12403             :                 {
   12404             :                     assert(reference_token[pos] == '~');
   12405             : 
   12406             :                     // ~ must be followed by 0 or 1
   12407             :                     if (pos == reference_token.size() - 1 or
   12408             :                         (reference_token[pos + 1] != '0' and
   12409             :                          reference_token[pos + 1] != '1'))
   12410             :                     {
   12411             :                         JSON_THROW(
   12412             :                             std::domain_error("escape error: '~' must be "
   12413             :                                               "followed with '0' or '1'"));
   12414             :                     }
   12415             :                 }
   12416             : 
   12417             :                 // finally, store the reference token
   12418             :                 unescape(reference_token);
   12419             :                 result.push_back(reference_token);
   12420             :             }
   12421             : 
   12422             :             return result;
   12423             :         }
   12424             : 
   12425             :     private:
   12426             :         /*!
   12427             :         @brief replace all occurrences of a substring by another string
   12428             : 
   12429             :         @param[in,out] s  the string to manipulate; changed so that all
   12430             :                           occurrences of @a f are replaced with @a t
   12431             :         @param[in]     f  the substring to replace with @a t
   12432             :         @param[in]     t  the string to replace @a f
   12433             : 
   12434             :         @pre The search string @a f must not be empty.
   12435             : 
   12436             :         @since version 2.0.0
   12437             :         */
   12438             :         static void replace_substring(std::string& s, const std::string& f,
   12439             :                                       const std::string& t)
   12440             :         {
   12441             :             assert(not f.empty());
   12442             : 
   12443             :             for (size_t pos = s.find(f);         // find first occurrence of f
   12444             :                  pos != std::string::npos;       // make sure f was found
   12445             :                  s.replace(pos, f.size(), t),    // replace with t
   12446             :                  pos = s.find(f, pos + t.size()) // find next occurrence of f
   12447             :                  )
   12448             :                 ;
   12449             :         }
   12450             : 
   12451             :         /// escape tilde and slash
   12452             :         static std::string escape(std::string s)
   12453             :         {
   12454             :             // escape "~"" to "~0" and "/" to "~1"
   12455             :             replace_substring(s, "~", "~0");
   12456             :             replace_substring(s, "/", "~1");
   12457             :             return s;
   12458             :         }
   12459             : 
   12460             :         /// unescape tilde and slash
   12461             :         static void unescape(std::string& s)
   12462             :         {
   12463             :             // first transform any occurrence of the sequence '~1' to '/'
   12464             :             replace_substring(s, "~1", "/");
   12465             :             // then transform any occurrence of the sequence '~0' to '~'
   12466             :             replace_substring(s, "~0", "~");
   12467             :         }
   12468             : 
   12469             :         /*!
   12470             :         @param[in] reference_string  the reference string to the current value
   12471             :         @param[in] value             the value to consider
   12472             :         @param[in,out] result        the result object to insert values to
   12473             : 
   12474             :         @note Empty objects or arrays are flattened to `null`.
   12475             :         */
   12476             :         static void flatten(const std::string& reference_string,
   12477             :                             const basic_json& value, basic_json& result)
   12478             :         {
   12479             :             switch (value.m_type)
   12480             :             {
   12481             :             case value_t::array:
   12482             :             {
   12483             :                 if (value.m_value.array->empty())
   12484             :                 {
   12485             :                     // flatten empty array as null
   12486             :                     result[reference_string] = nullptr;
   12487             :                 }
   12488             :                 else
   12489             :                 {
   12490             :                     // iterate array and use index as reference string
   12491             :                     for (size_t i = 0; i < value.m_value.array->size(); ++i)
   12492             :                     {
   12493             :                         flatten(reference_string + "/" + std::to_string(i),
   12494             :                                 value.m_value.array->operator[](i), result);
   12495             :                     }
   12496             :                 }
   12497             :                 break;
   12498             :             }
   12499             : 
   12500             :             case value_t::object:
   12501             :             {
   12502             :                 if (value.m_value.object->empty())
   12503             :                 {
   12504             :                     // flatten empty object as null
   12505             :                     result[reference_string] = nullptr;
   12506             :                 }
   12507             :                 else
   12508             :                 {
   12509             :                     // iterate object and use keys as reference string
   12510             :                     for (const auto& element : *value.m_value.object)
   12511             :                     {
   12512             :                         flatten(reference_string + "/" + escape(element.first),
   12513             :                                 element.second, result);
   12514             :                     }
   12515             :                 }
   12516             :                 break;
   12517             :             }
   12518             : 
   12519             :             default:
   12520             :             {
   12521             :                 // add primitive value with its reference string
   12522             :                 result[reference_string] = value;
   12523             :                 break;
   12524             :             }
   12525             :             }
   12526             :         }
   12527             : 
   12528             :         /*!
   12529             :         @param[in] value  flattened JSON
   12530             : 
   12531             :         @return unflattened JSON
   12532             :         */
   12533             :         static basic_json unflatten(const basic_json& value)
   12534             :         {
   12535             :             if (not value.is_object())
   12536             :             {
   12537             :                 JSON_THROW(
   12538             :                     std::domain_error("only objects can be unflattened"));
   12539             :             }
   12540             : 
   12541             :             basic_json result;
   12542             : 
   12543             :             // iterate the JSON object values
   12544             :             for (const auto& element : *value.m_value.object)
   12545             :             {
   12546             :                 if (not element.second.is_primitive())
   12547             :                 {
   12548             :                     JSON_THROW(std::domain_error(
   12549             :                         "values in object must be primitive"));
   12550             :                 }
   12551             : 
   12552             :                 // assign value to reference pointed to by JSON pointer; Note
   12553             :                 // that if the JSON pointer is "" (i.e., points to the whole
   12554             :                 // value), function get_and_create returns a reference to
   12555             :                 // result itself. An assignment will then create a primitive
   12556             :                 // value.
   12557             :                 json_pointer(element.first).get_and_create(result) =
   12558             :                     element.second;
   12559             :             }
   12560             : 
   12561             :             return result;
   12562             :         }
   12563             : 
   12564             :     private:
   12565             :         friend bool operator==(json_pointer const& lhs,
   12566             :                                json_pointer const& rhs) noexcept
   12567             :         {
   12568             :             return lhs.reference_tokens == rhs.reference_tokens;
   12569             :         }
   12570             : 
   12571             :         friend bool operator!=(json_pointer const& lhs,
   12572             :                                json_pointer const& rhs) noexcept
   12573             :         {
   12574             :             return !(lhs == rhs);
   12575             :         }
   12576             : 
   12577             :         /// the reference tokens
   12578             :         std::vector<std::string> reference_tokens{};
   12579             :     };
   12580             : 
   12581             :     //////////////////////////
   12582             :     // JSON Pointer support //
   12583             :     //////////////////////////
   12584             : 
   12585             :     /// @name JSON Pointer functions
   12586             :     /// @{
   12587             : 
   12588             :     /*!
   12589             :     @brief access specified element via JSON Pointer
   12590             : 
   12591             :     Uses a JSON pointer to retrieve a reference to the respective JSON value.
   12592             :     No bound checking is performed. Similar to @ref operator[](const typename
   12593             :     object_t::key_type&), `null` values are created in arrays and objects if
   12594             :     necessary.
   12595             : 
   12596             :     In particular:
   12597             :     - If the JSON pointer points to an object key that does not exist, it
   12598             :       is created an filled with a `null` value before a reference to it
   12599             :       is returned.
   12600             :     - If the JSON pointer points to an array index that does not exist, it
   12601             :       is created an filled with a `null` value before a reference to it
   12602             :       is returned. All indices between the current maximum and the given
   12603             :       index are also filled with `null`.
   12604             :     - The special value `-` is treated as a synonym for the index past the
   12605             :       end.
   12606             : 
   12607             :     @param[in] ptr  a JSON pointer
   12608             : 
   12609             :     @return reference to the element pointed to by @a ptr
   12610             : 
   12611             :     @complexity Constant.
   12612             : 
   12613             :     @throw std::out_of_range      if the JSON pointer can not be resolved
   12614             :     @throw std::domain_error      if an array index begins with '0'
   12615             :     @throw std::invalid_argument  if an array index was not a number
   12616             : 
   12617             :     @liveexample{The behavior is shown in the example.,operatorjson_pointer}
   12618             : 
   12619             :     @since version 2.0.0
   12620             :     */
   12621             :     reference operator[](const json_pointer& ptr)
   12622             :     {
   12623             :         return ptr.get_unchecked(this);
   12624             :     }
   12625             : 
   12626             :     /*!
   12627             :     @brief access specified element via JSON Pointer
   12628             : 
   12629             :     Uses a JSON pointer to retrieve a reference to the respective JSON value.
   12630             :     No bound checking is performed. The function does not change the JSON
   12631             :     value; no `null` values are created. In particular, the the special value
   12632             :     `-` yields an exception.
   12633             : 
   12634             :     @param[in] ptr  JSON pointer to the desired element
   12635             : 
   12636             :     @return const reference to the element pointed to by @a ptr
   12637             : 
   12638             :     @complexity Constant.
   12639             : 
   12640             :     @throw std::out_of_range      if the JSON pointer can not be resolved
   12641             :     @throw std::domain_error      if an array index begins with '0'
   12642             :     @throw std::invalid_argument  if an array index was not a number
   12643             : 
   12644             :     @liveexample{The behavior is shown in the
   12645             :     example.,operatorjson_pointer_const}
   12646             : 
   12647             :     @since version 2.0.0
   12648             :     */
   12649             :     const_reference operator[](const json_pointer& ptr) const
   12650             :     {
   12651             :         return ptr.get_unchecked(this);
   12652             :     }
   12653             : 
   12654             :     /*!
   12655             :     @brief access specified element via JSON Pointer
   12656             : 
   12657             :     Returns a reference to the element at with specified JSON pointer @a ptr,
   12658             :     with bounds checking.
   12659             : 
   12660             :     @param[in] ptr  JSON pointer to the desired element
   12661             : 
   12662             :     @return reference to the element pointed to by @a ptr
   12663             : 
   12664             :     @complexity Constant.
   12665             : 
   12666             :     @throw std::out_of_range      if the JSON pointer can not be resolved
   12667             :     @throw std::domain_error      if an array index begins with '0'
   12668             :     @throw std::invalid_argument  if an array index was not a number
   12669             : 
   12670             :     @liveexample{The behavior is shown in the example.,at_json_pointer}
   12671             : 
   12672             :     @since version 2.0.0
   12673             :     */
   12674             :     reference at(const json_pointer& ptr) { return ptr.get_checked(this); }
   12675             :     /*!
   12676             :     @brief access specified element via JSON Pointer
   12677             : 
   12678             :     Returns a const reference to the element at with specified JSON pointer @a
   12679             :     ptr, with bounds checking.
   12680             : 
   12681             :     @param[in] ptr  JSON pointer to the desired element
   12682             : 
   12683             :     @return reference to the element pointed to by @a ptr
   12684             : 
   12685             :     @complexity Constant.
   12686             : 
   12687             :     @throw std::out_of_range      if the JSON pointer can not be resolved
   12688             :     @throw std::domain_error      if an array index begins with '0'
   12689             :     @throw std::invalid_argument  if an array index was not a number
   12690             : 
   12691             :     @liveexample{The behavior is shown in the example.,at_json_pointer_const}
   12692             : 
   12693             :     @since version 2.0.0
   12694             :     */
   12695             :     const_reference at(const json_pointer& ptr) const
   12696             :     {
   12697             :         return ptr.get_checked(this);
   12698             :     }
   12699             : 
   12700             :     /*!
   12701             :     @brief return flattened JSON value
   12702             : 
   12703             :     The function creates a JSON object whose keys are JSON pointers (see [RFC
   12704             :     6901](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901)) and whose values are all
   12705             :     primitive. The original JSON value can be restored using the @ref
   12706             :     unflatten() function.
   12707             : 
   12708             :     @return an object that maps JSON pointers to primitive values
   12709             : 
   12710             :     @note Empty objects and arrays are flattened to `null` and will not be
   12711             :           reconstructed correctly by the @ref unflatten() function.
   12712             : 
   12713             :     @complexity Linear in the size the JSON value.
   12714             : 
   12715             :     @liveexample{The following code shows how a JSON object is flattened to an
   12716             :     object whose keys consist of JSON pointers.,flatten}
   12717             : 
   12718             :     @sa @ref unflatten() for the reverse function
   12719             : 
   12720             :     @since version 2.0.0
   12721             :     */
   12722             :     basic_json flatten() const
   12723             :     {
   12724             :         basic_json result(value_t::object);
   12725             :         json_pointer::flatten("", *this, result);
   12726             :         return result;
   12727             :     }
   12728             : 
   12729             :     /*!
   12730             :     @brief unflatten a previously flattened JSON value
   12731             : 
   12732             :     The function restores the arbitrary nesting of a JSON value that has been
   12733             :     flattened before using the @ref flatten() function. The JSON value must
   12734             :     meet certain constraints:
   12735             :     1. The value must be an object.
   12736             :     2. The keys must be JSON pointers (see
   12737             :        [RFC 6901](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901))
   12738             :     3. The mapped values must be primitive JSON types.
   12739             : 
   12740             :     @return the original JSON from a flattened version
   12741             : 
   12742             :     @note Empty objects and arrays are flattened by @ref flatten() to `null`
   12743             :           values and can not unflattened to their original type. Apart from
   12744             :           this example, for a JSON value `j`, the following is always true:
   12745             :           `j == j.flatten().unflatten()`.
   12746             : 
   12747             :     @complexity Linear in the size the JSON value.
   12748             : 
   12749             :     @liveexample{The following code shows how a flattened JSON object is
   12750             :     unflattened into the original nested JSON object.,unflatten}
   12751             : 
   12752             :     @sa @ref flatten() for the reverse function
   12753             : 
   12754             :     @since version 2.0.0
   12755             :     */
   12756             :     basic_json unflatten() const { return json_pointer::unflatten(*this); }
   12757             :     /// @}
   12758             : 
   12759             :     //////////////////////////
   12760             :     // JSON Patch functions //
   12761             :     //////////////////////////
   12762             : 
   12763             :     /// @name JSON Patch functions
   12764             :     /// @{
   12765             : 
   12766             :     /*!
   12767             :     @brief applies a JSON patch
   12768             : 
   12769             :     [JSON Patch](http://jsonpatch.com) defines a JSON document structure for
   12770             :     expressing a sequence of operations to apply to a JSON) document. With
   12771             :     this function, a JSON Patch is applied to the current JSON value by
   12772             :     executing all operations from the patch.
   12773             : 
   12774             :     @param[in] json_patch  JSON patch document
   12775             :     @return patched document
   12776             : 
   12777             :     @note The application of a patch is atomic: Either all operations succeed
   12778             :           and the patched document is returned or an exception is thrown. In
   12779             :           any case, the original value is not changed: the patch is applied
   12780             :           to a copy of the value.
   12781             : 
   12782             :     @throw std::out_of_range if a JSON pointer inside the patch could not
   12783             :     be resolved successfully in the current JSON value; example: `"key baz
   12784             :     not found"`
   12785             :     @throw invalid_argument if the JSON patch is malformed (e.g., mandatory
   12786             :     attributes are missing); example: `"operation add must have member path"`
   12787             : 
   12788             :     @complexity Linear in the size of the JSON value and the length of the
   12789             :     JSON patch. As usually only a fraction of the JSON value is affected by
   12790             :     the patch, the complexity can usually be neglected.
   12791             : 
   12792             :     @liveexample{The following code shows how a JSON patch is applied to a
   12793             :     value.,patch}
   12794             : 
   12795             :     @sa @ref diff -- create a JSON patch by comparing two JSON values
   12796             : 
   12797             :     @sa [RFC 6902 (JSON Patch)](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6902)
   12798             :     @sa [RFC 6901 (JSON Pointer)](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901)
   12799             : 
   12800             :     @since version 2.0.0
   12801             :     */
   12802             :     basic_json patch(const basic_json& json_patch) const
   12803             :     {
   12804             :         // make a working copy to apply the patch to
   12805             :         basic_json result = *this;
   12806             : 
   12807             :         // the valid JSON Patch operations
   12808             :         enum class patch_operations
   12809             :         {
   12810             :             add,
   12811             :             remove,
   12812             :             replace,
   12813             :             move,
   12814             :             copy,
   12815             :             test,
   12816             :             invalid
   12817             :         };
   12818             : 
   12819             :         const auto get_op = [](const std::string op) {
   12820             :             if (op == "add")
   12821             :             {
   12822             :                 return patch_operations::add;
   12823             :             }
   12824             :             if (op == "remove")
   12825             :             {
   12826             :                 return patch_operations::remove;
   12827             :             }
   12828             :             if (op == "replace")
   12829             :             {
   12830             :                 return patch_operations::replace;
   12831             :             }
   12832             :             if (op == "move")
   12833             :             {
   12834             :                 return patch_operations::move;
   12835             :             }
   12836             :             if (op == "copy")
   12837             :             {
   12838             :                 return patch_operations::copy;
   12839             :             }
   12840             :             if (op == "test")
   12841             :             {
   12842             :                 return patch_operations::test;
   12843             :             }
   12844             : 
   12845             :             return patch_operations::invalid;
   12846             :         };
   12847             : 
   12848             :         // wrapper for "add" operation; add value at ptr
   12849             :         const auto operation_add = [&result](json_pointer& ptr,
   12850             :                                              basic_json val) {
   12851             :             // adding to the root of the target document means replacing it
   12852             :             if (ptr.is_root())
   12853             :             {
   12854             :                 result = val;
   12855             :             }
   12856             :             else
   12857             :             {
   12858             :                 // make sure the top element of the pointer exists
   12859             :                 json_pointer top_pointer = ptr.top();
   12860             :                 if (top_pointer != ptr)
   12861             :                 {
   12862             :                     result.at(top_pointer);
   12863             :                 }
   12864             : 
   12865             :                 // get reference to parent of JSON pointer ptr
   12866             :                 const auto last_path = ptr.pop_back();
   12867             :                 basic_json& parent = result[ptr];
   12868             : 
   12869             :                 switch (parent.m_type)
   12870             :                 {
   12871             :                 case value_t::null:
   12872             :                 case value_t::object:
   12873             :                 {
   12874             :                     // use operator[] to add value
   12875             :                     parent[last_path] = val;
   12876             :                     break;
   12877             :                 }
   12878             : 
   12879             :                 case value_t::array:
   12880             :                 {
   12881             :                     if (last_path == "-")
   12882             :                     {
   12883             :                         // special case: append to back
   12884             :                         parent.push_back(val);
   12885             :                     }
   12886             :                     else
   12887             :                     {
   12888             :                         const auto idx = std::stoi(last_path);
   12889             :                         if (static_cast<size_type>(idx) > parent.size())
   12890             :                         {
   12891             :                             // avoid undefined behavior
   12892             :                             JSON_THROW(std::out_of_range("array index " +
   12893             :                                                          std::to_string(idx) +
   12894             :                                                          " is out of range"));
   12895             :                         }
   12896             :                         else
   12897             :                         {
   12898             :                             // default case: insert add offset
   12899             :                             parent.insert(parent.begin() +
   12900             :                                               static_cast<difference_type>(idx),
   12901             :                                           val);
   12902             :                         }
   12903             :                     }
   12904             :                     break;
   12905             :                 }
   12906             : 
   12907             :                 default:
   12908             :                 {
   12909             :                     // if there exists a parent it cannot be primitive
   12910             :                     assert(false); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
   12911             :                 }
   12912             :                 }
   12913             :             }
   12914             :         };
   12915             : 
   12916             :         // wrapper for "remove" operation; remove value at ptr
   12917             :         const auto operation_remove = [&result](json_pointer& ptr) {
   12918             :             // get reference to parent of JSON pointer ptr
   12919             :             const auto last_path = ptr.pop_back();
   12920             :             basic_json& parent = result.at(ptr);
   12921             : 
   12922             :             // remove child
   12923             :             if (parent.is_object())
   12924             :             {
   12925             :                 // perform range check
   12926             :                 auto it = parent.find(last_path);
   12927             :                 if (it != parent.end())
   12928             :                 {
   12929             :                     parent.erase(it);
   12930             :                 }
   12931             :                 else
   12932             :                 {
   12933             :                     JSON_THROW(
   12934             :                         std::out_of_range("key '" + last_path + "' not found"));
   12935             :                 }
   12936             :             }
   12937             :             else if (parent.is_array())
   12938             :             {
   12939             :                 // note erase performs range check
   12940             :                 parent.erase(static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(last_path)));
   12941             :             }
   12942             :         };
   12943             : 
   12944             :         // type check
   12945             :         if (not json_patch.is_array())
   12946             :         {
   12947             :             // a JSON patch must be an array of objects
   12948             :             JSON_THROW(std::invalid_argument(
   12949             :                 "JSON patch must be an array of objects"));
   12950             :         }
   12951             : 
   12952             :         // iterate and apply the operations
   12953             :         for (const auto& val : json_patch)
   12954             :         {
   12955             :             // wrapper to get a value for an operation
   12956             :             const auto get_value = [&val](const std::string& op,
   12957             :                                           const std::string& member,
   12958             :                                           bool string_type) -> basic_json& {
   12959             :                 // find value
   12960             :                 auto it = val.m_value.object->find(member);
   12961             : 
   12962             :                 // context-sensitive error message
   12963             :                 const auto error_msg =
   12964             :                     (op == "op") ? "operation" : "operation '" + op + "'";
   12965             : 
   12966             :                 // check if desired value is present
   12967             :                 if (it == val.m_value.object->end())
   12968             :                 {
   12969             :                     JSON_THROW(std::invalid_argument(
   12970             :                         error_msg + " must have member '" + member + "'"));
   12971             :                 }
   12972             : 
   12973             :                 // check if result is of type string
   12974             :                 if (string_type and not it->second.is_string())
   12975             :                 {
   12976             :                     JSON_THROW(std::invalid_argument(
   12977             :                         error_msg + " must have string member '" + member +
   12978             :                         "'"));
   12979             :                 }
   12980             : 
   12981             :                 // no error: return value
   12982             :                 return it->second;
   12983             :             };
   12984             : 
   12985             :             // type check
   12986             :             if (not val.is_object())
   12987             :             {
   12988             :                 JSON_THROW(std::invalid_argument(
   12989             :                     "JSON patch must be an array of objects"));
   12990             :             }
   12991             : 
   12992             :             // collect mandatory members
   12993             :             const std::string op = get_value("op", "op", true);
   12994             :             const std::string path = get_value(op, "path", true);
   12995             :             json_pointer ptr(path);
   12996             : 
   12997             :             switch (get_op(op))
   12998             :             {
   12999             :             case patch_operations::add:
   13000             :             {
   13001             :                 operation_add(ptr, get_value("add", "value", false));
   13002             :                 break;
   13003             :             }
   13004             : 
   13005             :             case patch_operations::remove:
   13006             :             {
   13007             :                 operation_remove(ptr);
   13008             :                 break;
   13009             :             }
   13010             : 
   13011             :             case patch_operations::replace:
   13012             :             {
   13013             :                 // the "path" location must exist - use at()
   13014             :                 result.at(ptr) = get_value("replace", "value", false);
   13015             :                 break;
   13016             :             }
   13017             : 
   13018             :             case patch_operations::move:
   13019             :             {
   13020             :                 const std::string from_path = get_value("move", "from", true);
   13021             :                 json_pointer from_ptr(from_path);
   13022             : 
   13023             :                 // the "from" location must exist - use at()
   13024             :                 basic_json v = result.at(from_ptr);
   13025             : 
   13026             :                 // The move operation is functionally identical to a
   13027             :                 // "remove" operation on the "from" location, followed
   13028             :                 // immediately by an "add" operation at the target
   13029             :                 // location with the value that was just removed.
   13030             :                 operation_remove(from_ptr);
   13031             :                 operation_add(ptr, v);
   13032             :                 break;
   13033             :             }
   13034             : 
   13035             :             case patch_operations::copy:
   13036             :             {
   13037             :                 const std::string from_path = get_value("copy", "from", true);
   13038             :                 ;
   13039             :                 const json_pointer from_ptr(from_path);
   13040             : 
   13041             :                 // the "from" location must exist - use at()
   13042             :                 result[ptr] = result.at(from_ptr);
   13043             :                 break;
   13044             :             }
   13045             : 
   13046             :             case patch_operations::test:
   13047             :             {
   13048             :                 bool success = false;
   13049             :                 JSON_TRY
   13050             :                 {
   13051             :                     // check if "value" matches the one at "path"
   13052             :                     // the "path" location must exist - use at()
   13053             :                     success =
   13054             :                         (result.at(ptr) == get_value("test", "value", false));
   13055             :                 }
   13056             :                 JSON_CATCH(std::out_of_range&)
   13057             :                 {
   13058             :                     // ignore out of range errors: success remains false
   13059             :                 }
   13060             : 
   13061             :                 // throw an exception if test fails
   13062             :                 if (not success)
   13063             :                 {
   13064             :                     JSON_THROW(
   13065             :                         std::domain_error("unsuccessful: " + val.dump()));
   13066             :                 }
   13067             : 
   13068             :                 break;
   13069             :             }
   13070             : 
   13071             :             case patch_operations::invalid:
   13072             :             {
   13073             :                 // op must be "add", "remove", "replace", "move", "copy", or
   13074             :                 // "test"
   13075             :                 JSON_THROW(std::invalid_argument("operation value '" + op +
   13076             :                                                  "' is invalid"));
   13077             :             }
   13078             :             }
   13079             :         }
   13080             : 
   13081             :         return result;
   13082             :     }
   13083             : 
   13084             :     /*!
   13085             :     @brief creates a diff as a JSON patch
   13086             : 
   13087             :     Creates a [JSON Patch](http://jsonpatch.com) so that value @a source can
   13088             :     be changed into the value @a target by calling @ref patch function.
   13089             : 
   13090             :     @invariant For two JSON values @a source and @a target, the following code
