   13091             :     yields always `true`:
   13092             :     @code {.cpp}
   13093             :     source.patch(diff(source, target)) == target;
   13094             :     @endcode
   13095             : 
   13096             :     @note Currently, only `remove`, `add`, and `replace` operations are
   13097             :           generated.
   13098             : 
   13099             :     @param[in] source  JSON value to compare from
   13100             :     @param[in] target  JSON value to compare against
   13101             :     @param[in] path    helper value to create JSON pointers
   13102             : 
   13103             :     @return a JSON patch to convert the @a source to @a target
   13104             : 
   13105             :     @complexity Linear in the lengths of @a source and @a target.
   13106             : 
   13107             :     @liveexample{The following code shows how a JSON patch is created as a
   13108             :     diff for two JSON values.,diff}
   13109             : 
   13110             :     @sa @ref patch -- apply a JSON patch
   13111             : 
   13112             :     @sa [RFC 6902 (JSON Patch)](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6902)
   13113             : 
   13114             :     @since version 2.0.0
   13115             :     */
   13116             :     static basic_json diff(const basic_json& source, const basic_json& target,
   13117             :                            const std::string& path = "")
   13118             :     {
   13119             :         // the patch
   13120             :         basic_json result(value_t::array);
   13121             : 
   13122             :         // if the values are the same, return empty patch
   13123             :         if (source == target)
   13124             :         {
   13125             :             return result;
   13126             :         }
   13127             : 
   13128             :         if (source.type() != target.type())
   13129             :         {
   13130             :             // different types: replace value
   13131             :             result.push_back(
   13132             :                 {{"op", "replace"}, {"path", path}, {"value", target}});
   13133             :         }
   13134             :         else
   13135             :         {
   13136             :             switch (source.type())
   13137             :             {
   13138             :             case value_t::array:
   13139             :             {
   13140             :                 // first pass: traverse common elements
   13141             :                 size_t i = 0;
   13142             :                 while (i < source.size() and i < target.size())
   13143             :                 {
   13144             :                     // recursive call to compare array values at index i
   13145             :                     auto temp_diff = diff(source[i], target[i],
   13146             :                                           path + "/" + std::to_string(i));
   13147             :                     result.insert(result.end(), temp_diff.begin(),
   13148             :                                   temp_diff.end());
   13149             :                     ++i;
   13150             :                 }
   13151             : 
   13152             :                 // i now reached the end of at least one array
   13153             :                 // in a second pass, traverse the remaining elements
   13154             : 
   13155             :                 // remove my remaining elements
   13156             :                 const auto end_index =
   13157             :                     static_cast<difference_type>(result.size());
   13158             :                 while (i < source.size())
   13159             :                 {
   13160             :                     // add operations in reverse order to avoid invalid
   13161             :                     // indices
   13162             :                     result.insert(result.begin() + end_index,
   13163             :                                   object({{"op", "remove"},
   13164             :                                           {"path",
   13165             :                                            path + "/" + std::to_string(i)}}));
   13166             :                     ++i;
   13167             :                 }
   13168             : 
   13169             :                 // add other remaining elements
   13170             :                 while (i < target.size())
   13171             :                 {
   13172             :                     result.push_back({{"op", "add"},
   13173             :                                       {"path", path + "/" + std::to_string(i)},
   13174             :                                       {"value", target[i]}});
   13175             :                     ++i;
   13176             :                 }
   13177             : 
   13178             :                 break;
   13179             :             }
   13180             : 
   13181             :             case value_t::object:
   13182             :             {
   13183             :                 // first pass: traverse this object's elements
   13184             :                 for (auto it = source.begin(); it != source.end(); ++it)
   13185             :                 {
   13186             :                     // escape the key name to be used in a JSON patch
   13187             :                     const auto key = json_pointer::escape(it.key());
   13188             : 
   13189             :                     if (target.find(it.key()) != target.end())
   13190             :                     {
   13191             :                         // recursive call to compare object values at key it
   13192             :                         auto temp_diff = diff(it.value(), target[it.key()],
   13193             :                                               path + "/" + key);
   13194             :                         result.insert(result.end(), temp_diff.begin(),
   13195             :                                       temp_diff.end());
   13196             :                     }
   13197             :                     else
   13198             :                     {
   13199             :                         // found a key that is not in o -> remove it
   13200             :                         result.push_back(object(
   13201             :                             {{"op", "remove"}, {"path", path + "/" + key}}));
   13202             :                     }
   13203             :                 }
   13204             : 
   13205             :                 // second pass: traverse other object's elements
   13206             :                 for (auto it = target.begin(); it != target.end(); ++it)
   13207             :                 {
   13208             :                     if (source.find(it.key()) == source.end())
   13209             :                     {
   13210             :                         // found a key that is not in this -> add it
   13211             :                         const auto key = json_pointer::escape(it.key());
   13212             :                         result.push_back({{"op", "add"},
   13213             :                                           {"path", path + "/" + key},
   13214             :                                           {"value", it.value()}});
   13215             :                     }
   13216             :                 }
   13217             : 
   13218             :                 break;
   13219             :             }
   13220             : 
   13221             :             default:
   13222             :             {
   13223             :                 // both primitive type: replace value
   13224             :                 result.push_back(
   13225             :                     {{"op", "replace"}, {"path", path}, {"value", target}});
   13226             :                 break;
   13227             :             }
   13228             :             }
   13229             :         }
   13230             : 
   13231             :         return result;
   13232             :     }
   13233             : 
   13234             :     /// @}
   13235             : };
   13236             : 
   13237             : /////////////
   13238             : // presets //
   13239             : /////////////
   13240             : 
   13241             : /*!
   13242             : @brief default JSON class
   13243             : 
   13244             : This type is the default specialization of the @ref basic_json class which
   13245             : uses the standard template types.
   13246             : 
   13247             : @since version 1.0.0
   13248             : */
   13249             : using json = basic_json<>;
   13250             : } // namespace nlohmann
   13251             : 
   13252             : ///////////////////////
   13253             : // nonmember support //
   13254             : ///////////////////////
   13255             : 
   13256             : // specialization of std::swap, and std::hash
   13257             : namespace std
   13258             : {
   13259             : /*!
   13260             : @brief exchanges the values of two JSON objects
   13261             : 
   13262             : @since version 1.0.0
   13263             : */
   13264             : template <>
   13265             : inline void swap(nlohmann::json& j1, nlohmann::json& j2) noexcept(
   13266             :     is_nothrow_move_constructible<nlohmann::json>::value and
   13267             :         is_nothrow_move_assignable<nlohmann::json>::value)
   13268             : {
   13269             :     j1.swap(j2);
   13270             : }
   13271             : 
   13272             : /// hash value for JSON objects
   13273             : template <>
   13274             : struct hash<nlohmann::json>
   13275             : {
   13276             :     /*!
   13277             :     @brief return a hash value for a JSON object
   13278             : 
   13279             :     @since version 1.0.0
   13280             :     */
   13281             :     std::size_t operator()(const nlohmann::json& j) const
   13282             :     {
   13283             :         // a naive hashing via the string representation
   13284             :         const auto& h = hash<nlohmann::json::string_t>();
   13285             :         return h(j.dump());
   13286             :     }
   13287             : };
   13288             : } // namespace std
   13289             : 
   13290             : /*!
   13291             : @brief user-defined string literal for JSON values
   13292             : 
   13293             : This operator implements a user-defined string literal for JSON objects. It
   13294             : can be used by adding `"_json"` to a string literal and returns a JSON object
   13295             : if no parse error occurred.
   13296             : 
   13297             : @param[in] s  a string representation of a JSON object
   13298             : @param[in] n  the length of string @a s
   13299             : @return a JSON object
   13300             : 
   13301             : @since version 1.0.0
   13302             : */
   13303             : inline nlohmann::json operator"" _json(const char* s, std::size_t n)
   13304             : {
   13305             :     return nlohmann::json::parse(s, s + n);
   13306             : }
   13307             : 
   13308             : /*!
   13309             : @brief user-defined string literal for JSON pointer
   13310             : 
   13311             : This operator implements a user-defined string literal for JSON Pointers. It
   13312             : can be used by adding `"_json_pointer"` to a string literal and returns a JSON
   13313             : pointer
   13314             : object if no parse error occurred.
   13315             : 
   13316             : @param[in] s  a string representation of a JSON Pointer
   13317             : @param[in] n  the length of string @a s
   13318             : @return a JSON pointer object
   13319             : 
   13320             : @since version 2.0.0
   13321             : */
   13322             : inline nlohmann::json::json_pointer operator"" _json_pointer(const char* s,
   13323             :                                                              std::size_t n)
   13324             : {
   13325             :     return nlohmann::json::json_pointer(std::string(s, n));
   13326             : }
   13327             : 
   13328             : // restore GCC/clang diagnostic settings
   13329             : #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
   13330             : #pragma GCC diagnostic pop
   13331             : #endif
   13332             : 
   13333             : // clean up
   13334             : #undef JSON_CATCH
   13335             : #undef JSON_DEPRECATED
   13336             : #undef JSON_THROW
   13337             : #undef JSON_TRY
   13338             : 
   13339             : #endif
